19  void EnvAR::reset(double _sample_rate)
20  {
21  sample_rate = _sample_rate;
22 
23  counter = 0.0;
24  delta = 0.0;
25  prev_output = 0.0;
26  }

31  }

39 
40  void EnvAR::trigger()
41  {
42  is_triggered = true;
43  }
44 
45  float EnvAR::process()
46  {
47  float output{0.0};
48  float counter_inv{0.0};
49 
50  // Find next output
51  switch (state)
52  {
53  case EnvState::IDLE:
54  output = 0.0f;
55  break;
56 
57  case EnvState::ATTACK:
58 
59  // Find curve
60 
61  // ATTACK "aims higher" to make the curve more linear, like in the analog circuit
62  // 12 V is given by the Eurorack power specs (envelope output peaks at 8 V)
63  // output = adsp::skewNormalized(counter, 1.8);
64  output = maps::map_linear_norm_pos(counter, seg_start, ENV_AMPLITUDE);
65 
66  // Increment counter
67  counter += delta;
68  break;
69 
70  case EnvState::RELEASE:
71 
72  // Shape and scale to desired linear segment
73  // Counter needs to be inverted for the correct shape of the decreasing segment
74  counter_inv = 1.0f - counter;
75  counter_inv = maps::skew_norm_pos(counter_inv, 0.2f);
76  counter_inv = 1.0f - counter_inv;
77  output = maps::map_linear_norm_pos(counter_inv, seg_start, 0.0f);
78 
79  // Decrement counter
80  counter += delta;
81 
82  break;
83  }
84 
85  // Check for state transitions
86  transition_state();
87 
88  // Save output for future calculations
89  prev_output = output;
90 
91  return output;
92  }
93 
94  //==============================================================================
95 
96  void EnvAR::update_delta()
97  {
98  // Adjust time to compensate the curve "aiming higher" in ATTACK
99 
100  double time_adjusted = time;
101 
102  if (state == EnvState::ATTACK)
103  {
104  time_adjusted = 12.0f / 8.0f * time;
105  }
106 
107  // Calculate new delta
108  delta = 1.0f / (time_adjusted * sample_rate);
109  }
110 
111  void EnvAR::transition_state()
112  {
113  switch (state)
114  {
115  case EnvState::IDLE:
116  // If triggered in IDLE..
117  if (is_triggered)
118  {
119  // Change to ATTACK phase
120  state = EnvState::ATTACK;
121 
122  // Get new timing constant
123  time = attack;
124 
125  update_delta();
126 
127  counter = 0.0f;
128 
129  // Start ATTACK segment from zero
130  seg_start = 0.0f;
131  }
132  break;
133 
134  case EnvState::ATTACK:
135  // If ATTACK phase is over..
136  if (prev_output >= (ENV_AMPLITUDE - VOLTAGE_MARGIN))
137  {
138  // Change to RELEASE phase
139  state = EnvState::RELEASE;
140 
141  // Get new timing constant
142  time = release;
143 
144  update_delta();
145 
146  counter = 0.0f;
147 
148  // Start release phase from current output voltage
149  seg_start = prev_output;
150  }
151  break;
152 
153  case EnvState::RELEASE:
154  // If envelope is triggered in RELEASE..
155  if (is_triggered)
156  {
157  // Change to ATTACK phase
158  state = EnvState::ATTACK;
159 
160  // Set new timing constant
161  time = attack;
162 
163  // Update increment
164  update_delta();
165 
166  // Reset counter
167  counter = 0.0f;
168 
169  // Start ATTACK from current output value
170  seg_start = prev_output;
171  }
172  // If RELEASE phase is over..
173  else if (prev_output <= (0.0f + VOLTAGE_MARGIN))
174  {
175  // Change back to IDLE phase
176  state = EnvState::IDLE;
177  }
178  break;
179  }
180 
181  // Untrigger envelope, so it doenst hang in attack
182  is_triggered = false;
183  }
184 
185  } // namespace env
186 } // namespace bdsp

Maps a normalized positive value (0.0 to 1.0) to a given output range The "lo" bound can be higher th...
